edu.mccc.cos210.fp2014.cm.util

Class Tree<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mccc.cos210.fp2014.cm.util.Tree<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AiTree

    public class Tree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple tree structure. Each root has several leaves, which are in turn trees as well. This is our internal representation of possible boards from a given point in time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tree(T t) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLeaf(T t)
      Adds a leaf to the tree
      java.util.List<Tree<T>> getLeaves()
      This returns a list of all of the leaves, possibilities stemming from our original root.
      T getRoot()
      Returns the root of the tree, the element from which all other possibilities orrur.
      boolean hasLeaves()
      Returns true if the root has leaves, false otherwise.
      void trimTree(T t)
      Trims the tree to the values passed into as a paramater This removes all branches except the root t and any subsequent children if it has any.

        public T getRoot()

      • getLeaves

        public java.util.List<Tree<T>> getLeaves()
        This returns a list of all of the leaves, possibilities stemming from our original root.
        Returns:
        a list of all leaves (and their trees as well)

      • hasLeaves

        public boolean hasLeaves()
        Returns true if the root has leaves, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        whether or not the tree has leaves

      • addLeaf

        Adds a leaf to the tree
        Parameters:

      • trimTree

        public void trimTree(T t)
        Trims the tree to the values passed into as a paramater This removes all branches except the root t and any subsequent children if it has any.
        Parameters:
        t - the value to trim the tree to.
